name: df-func
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7, setvar s8, setvar s9
body: |- wceq(cfunc, cmpo(s0, s1, ccat, ccat, copab(s2, s3, wsbc(s4, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), w3a(wf(cv(s2), cv(s4), cfv(cbs, cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s3), cixp(s5, cxp(cv(s4), cv(s4)), co(co(cfv(cv(s2), cfv(c1st, cv(s5))), cfv(chom, cv(s1)), cfv(cv(s2), cfv(c2nd, cv(s5)))), cmap, cfv(cfv(chom, cv(s0)), cv(s5))))), wral(s6, cv(s4), wa(wceq(cfv(co(cv(s6), cv(s3), cv(s6)), cfv(cfv(ccid, cv(s0)), cv(s6))), cfv(cfv(ccid, cv(s1)), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s6)))), wral(s7, cv(s4), wral(s5, cv(s4), wral(s8, co(cv(s6), cfv(chom, cv(s0)), cv(s7)), wral(s9, co(cv(s7), cfv(chom, cv(s0)), cv(s5)), wceq(cfv(co(cv(s6), cv(s3), cv(s5)), co(cv(s9), co(cop(cv(s6), cv(s7)), cfv(cco, cv(s0)), cv(s5)), cv(s8))), co(cfv(co(cv(s7), cv(s3), cv(s5)), cv(s9)), co(cop(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s6)), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s7))), cfv(cco, cv(s1)), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s5))), cfv(co(cv(s6), cv(s3), cv(s7)), cv(s8)))))))))))))))
comment: Function returning all the functors from a category ` t ` to a category ` u ` . Definition 3.17 of [Adamek] p. 29, and definition in [Lang] p. 62 ("covariant functor"). Intuitively a functor associates any morphism of ` t ` to a morphism of ` u ` , any object of ` t ` to an object of ` u ` , and respects the identity, the composition, the domain and the codomain. Here to capture the idea that a functor associates any object of ` t ` to an object of ` u ` we write it associates any identity of ` t ` to an identity of ` u ` which simplifies the definition. According to remark 3.19 in [Adamek] p. 30, "a functor F : A -> B is technically a family of functions; one from Ob(A) to Ob(B) [here: f, called "the object part" in the following], and for each pair (A,A') of A-objects, one from hom(A,A') to hom(FA, FA') [here: g, called "the morphism part" in the following]". (Contributed by FL, 10-Feb-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jan-2017.)
